snippet: According to a complaint, Ofer Biton deceived the government about the source of $500,000 that he claimed to have put into a new business to make him eligible for a permanent visa.
abstract: Ofer Biton, former aide to Rabbi Yoshiyahu Pinto of Manhattan, is arrested on immigration-fraud charges; Biton has recently emerged as a key figure in the 2009-2010 Congressional campaign of Rep Michael G Grimm, Republican who represents Staten Island and Brooklyn and is seeking re-election; Biton is said to have raised much of Grimm’s campaign money from the rabbi’s followers and left the impression he expected help with his visa problems in return.
lead_paragraph: According to a complaint, Ofer Biton deceived the government about the source of $500,000 that he claimed to have put into a new business to make him eligible for a permanent visa.

headline.seo: Biton, Fund-Raiser for Grimm, Accused of Immigration Fraud
headline.main: Congressional Fund-Raiser Charged With Immigration Fraud
